author: bensode123

comments.body: Same issue here.
Please try changing the setting `Use Windows trust store` in Preferences->Connections and restarting DBeaver. If you haven't overridden the trust store, it might help.
Turns out Infor needed to provide updated TLS certs for their datalake access.  We opened a support request in parallel here and Infor provided the instructions to acquire updated certs.

> Turns out Infor needed to provide updated TLS certs for their datalake access. We opened a support request in parallel here and Infor provided the instructions to acquire updated certs.

Could you possibly post the instructions from Infor here or provide the KB?   

Thanks!

### Instructions from Infor :

For selective users potentially impacted with the below error while connecting to the Data Lake via 3rd party tools such as DBeaver, or others, please follow the below steps to update the Windows Trust Store on the specific client machine.   

Unable to verify trust for server certificate chain [CN=*.dmp.inforcloudsuite.com, CN=Amazon RSA 2048 M02, O=Amazon, C=US, CN=Amazon Root CA 1, O=Amazon, C=US  

###  Steps:

1. Obtain a copy of your ION API credentials. Opening your credentials locate the "iu" and "pu" entry and their values - We will need to get the certificates of the two URL’s those two URLs. In Edge, open both URLs. You may get a 404 error or something similar, this is fine. We only care about the certificate. For both tabs, click on the lock icon beside the URL  

2. From there, click the connection information  

3. And then the show certificate button  

4. In the certificate info window, click the details tab. In the bottom right of the details tab, click the export button, selecting PKCS#7 certificate chain as the save type.

5. Next, hit windows key + r to open the run dialog, then type mmc  

6. From the console menu bar, select File → Add/Remove Snap-in  

7. Add the certificates snap in, selecting My user account in the preceding options pop-up. Then click OK.  

8. In the side navigation pane, select the new certificates option, then right click on Personal selecting All Tasks → Import  

9. Set the file type to all, then select the first certificate you downloaded in the file selector. Click open, then next.  

10. Select “Automatically select certificate store based on the type of certificate”, then click next and finish to being the import.  

11. Repeat steps 8 through 10 for the remaining certificates.  

12. Once all certificates are imported, exit the mcc console. You may save your profile if you wish.  

13. The latest certificates should now be on your system. You may need to reboot your system for the changes to take effect

title: Left tree collapses at random
body:
### Description

The database/tables tree get collapsed at will.

### DBeaver Version

Version 24.1.5.202408181605

### Operating System

macOS Sonoma 14.6.1

### Database and driver

PostgreSQL, but it does not matter for this bug report.

### Steps to reproduce

1. Expand the database/tables tree on the left.
2. Put your laptop to sleep for a minute.
3. Awake your laptop
4. The tree is collapsed

### Additional context

_No response_
author: meglio

comments.body:
> 1. Expand the database/tables tree on the left.

At this step database connection is being established and DBeaver reads information about the tables from the database.

> 2. Put your laptop to sleep for a minute.

At this step database connection is being broken, but the system switched to sleep mode, so DBeaver may not have time to react.

> 3. Awake your laptop

At this step the DBeaver also awakes and finally handles disconnect (the same as when you intentionally click "Disconnect" while the database is selected), so the database subtree contents cannot be manipulated with, so DBeaver collapses it.
Autoreconnect could have been initiated here, but only if the disconnection detected during normal DBeaver operation. But in this case it is a result of sleep preparation procedure, so then DBeaver just handles system's state change. 

> 4. The tree is collapsed

@

title: Web Browser Setting Does Not Work
body:
### Description

I've configured my DBeaver to use my system's configured default browser, in this case it is the BrowserPicker Windows app that is a "middle-man" that allows me to choose which browser to open the link with.
Since installing the latest version of DBeaver along with the latest version of Chrome v126.0.6478.183 (64-bit) I've found that DBeaver immediately opens all links in Chrome. 
I've already made sure that my Windows default browser settings are set to "BrowserPicker". 
I've tried changing the settings in Preferences > User Interface > Web Browser to all other options: 
"Default system web browser", "Firefox", "Microsoft Edge", even setting it to use the internal web browser 
but DBeaver seems to ignore this setting and continues to open links in Chrome. 
I'm not sure if this is a bug caused by the latest version of DBeaver or the latest version of Chrome being intrusive with the default browser settings. 


### DBeaver Version

24.1.3.202407211303

### Operating System

Windows 11

### Database and driver

MariaDB JDBC driver

### Steps to reproduce

1. Select a web browser in Preferences > User Interface > Web Browser.
2. Retrieve/generate a URL in Database results. 
3. Click on Open URL shortcut in the results view grid.

### Additional context

Edit: Additional findings: Only the first (left-most) data column in the results display that is a URL would immediately open in Chrome. Subsequent data columns containing a URL would load in the "Browser Picker" app as per configured as my Windows default browser. It still ignores whatever web browser is selected in DBeaver's Preferences setting.
author: BenjaminWKI

comments.body:
@BenjaminWKI Hi, DBeaver doesn't use Chrome. It relies on Microsoft Edge for the internal browser functionality. Web Browser page is part of the Eclipse functionality and doesn't change any internal browser settings. 
Unfortunately, Firefox is not a choice for our graphic framework. 
Our platform also supports changes to Internet Explorer for Windows. However, because it is outdated, I would not recommend using it. 

Also, regarding the external browser, DBeaver mostly uses the default system URI handler, so if Chrome is configured as a default browser, the link will open through Chrome.

Hi @Destrolaric 
For some reason the bug no longer occurs after I powered up my system back on at the start of today. 
Seems like this bug isn't consistent and disappears after a reboot/program restart. 
You may close the ticket. 
Thanks for your time.
so what is the point of the Browser Picker?

author: GeriZ

comments.body: Any idea from one of the DBeaver developers?

It seems that these settings are saved in org.eclipse.equinox.p2.engine.prefs under C:\Program Files\DBeaver\p2\org.eclipse.equinox.p2.engine\profileRegistry\DefaultProfile.profile\.data\.settings.

Should user preferences not be saved anywhere in C:\Users\xxxx\AppData\Roaming\DBeaverData?

Hi @GeriZ,
We are using:
```
1 Configuration scope. Preferences stored in this scope are shared by all workspaces that are launched using a particular configuration of Eclipse plug-ins. On a single-user installation, this serves to capture preferences that are common to all workspaces launched by that user. On a multi-user installation, these preferences are shared by all users of the configuration.
2 Instance scope. Preferences in this scope are specific to a single Eclipse workspace. The old API method getPluginPreferences on Plugin stores its preferences at this scope.
```
The location of preferences depends on the installation mode (for All users, Only for me) or unzip mode.
By default, you can find your preferences at   
C:\Users\xxxx\AppData\Roaming\DBeaverData\workspace6\.metadata\.plugins
If you are using unzip to some location the preferences path will be relative to your product location.

title: PostgreSQL incorrect statement separation
body:
### Description

DBEaver doesn't separate statements correctly after CREATE PROCEDURE ... LANGUAGE SQL BEGIN ATOMIC ...


### DBeaver Version

Community edition Version 24.1.1.202406231636

### Operating System

Ubuntu 20.04

### Database and driver

Postgresql 15
Driver 42.7.2

### Steps to reproduce

Paste this SQL code, and select all for execute at once:
```
CREATE TABLE test_table(id int, string varchar);
CREATE PROCEDURE test_proc(testdata test_table[])
LANGUAGE SQL
BEGIN ATOMIC
    INSERT INTO test_table (id, string)
    SELECT id, string from unnest(testdata);
END;
CALL test_proc(testdata => ARRAY[(1, 'one'), (2, 'two')]::test_table[]);

```

Result is SQL Error [42601]: ERROR: cannot insert multiple commands into a prepared statement

### Additional context

Using psql, no issues:
```
test=# CREATE TABLE test_table(id int, string varchar);
CREATE TABLE
test=# CREATE PROCEDURE test_proc(testdata test_table[])
test-# LANGUAGE SQL
test-# BEGIN ATOMIC
test-#     INSERT INTO test_table (id, string)
test-#     SELECT id, string from unnest(testdata);
test-# END;
CREATE PROCEDURE
test=# CALL test_proc(testdata => ARRAY[(1, 'one'), (2, 'two')]::test_table[]);
CALL

```
In case of sequential execution of CREATE TABLE and CALL in DBEaver - also no issues.
author: vpetryaev

comments.body: Thank you for bug report.

Please try executing it as script.
When you select something in SQL Editor and press Execute (Ctrl+Enter), the selected part of text will be send as a single statement to the database for execution. If you want to execute several statements, this way of execution doesn't fit.

title: Error using variable in subqueries

When using variables in subquery the replace is missplaced.

Query:
```sql
@set myvar = '123456';
delete from mytable where fk = (select id from othertable where var = :myvar );
```

Error position: line: 6 pos: 136

With final/replaced query:
```
delete from mytable where fk = (select id from othertable where var = '123456'; )
```

Community Version 24.1.0.202406091028

### Operating System

macOS Sonoma 14.5

### Database and driver

1. Database PostgreSQL

### Steps to reproduce

See description

### Additional context

_No response_
author: guilhermefacanha

comments.body: Thank you for bug report.
Actually, it's not a bug. The value for variable is everything between `=` and the new line. So, you just don't need a `;` here.

1. Create DB backup in SQL format. "DROP if exists" & "CREATE if not exists" should be on.
2. Try to restore DB from this script: open the file, push `Alt-X` (`Option-X`).
3. Get an error.

### Additional context

_No response_
author: dayfuaim

comments.body:
Hello @dayfuaim,

The `\connect` is a meta-command available only in PSQL. DBeaver doesn't know anything about it.

What you want to do instead is to use **Tools -> Restore**.

title: Do not change view formatting after saving
body:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**
I'm using MariaDB and MySQL, everytime I save view on the database a lot parentesys and quotation marks and I would like to keep the format that I use to create the SQL query to be used in the view.

**Describe the solution you'd like**
I would like to keep the format as I used to create originally 

**Describe alternatives you've considered**
A button or option to be select when saving the view to select if you want to keep the original format or save as the database defaults.

**Additional context**
Add any other context or screenshots about the feature request here.
author: cezarbarboza1

comments.body:
Hello @cezarbarboza1,

Sorry, but it's not possible.

The query submitted to the database is processed and transformed by the database itself and stored in, likely, a compiled form that lacks any comments or specific formatting. To retrieve its DDL, DBeaver uses a set of commands supported by the database, e.g., `SHOW CREATE VIEW`.

title: Unable to Capitalize Column Names
body:
### Description

SELECT random_column as "Random Column"
FROM table

The output table will have a column called "random column".
How do I get DBeaver to persist the capitalization? Thanks.

### DBeaver Version

Dbeaver Community 23.1.4

### Operating System

_No response_

### Database and driver

_No response_

### Steps to reproduce

_No response_

### Additional context

_No response_
author: kevinfusmithrx

comments.body: What database do you use?
I couldn't reproduced the issue against SQLite and PostgreSQL
@E1izabeth Amazon Redshift

Hello @kevinfusmithrx,

Sorry for the long wait.

It's a default behavior in Redshift. To force identifiers to be case-sensitive, you can use the following statement:

```sql
SET enable_case_sensitive_identifier TO true;
```

You can either alter your user and set this parameter:

```sql
ALTER USER your-user SET enable_case_sensitive_identifier TO true;
```

Or use bootstrap queries in DBeaver and use the statement provided above:
1. Open connection configuration
2. Go to **Connection settings** ⇒ **Initialization** ⇒ **Bootstrap queries**

Please let me know if it helps.

No worries!
So where would i put that statement? Just before the select statement, like this, and then run my query as usual?

```
SET enable_case_sensitive_identifier TO true;
SELECT random_column as "Random Column"
FROM table;
```
Yes, before any other queries. I believe the issue is resolved, so I will close the ticket.

title: query is giving %ge calculation as 0 for all columns.  when however all should be over 1%
body:
### Description

Following query is not giving %ge.  it is giving 0 for all %ge calculations

select count(*) as non_pas_ids,
	(count(*) filter (where c.age  is null)) /count(*) * 100 as age_missing
,(count(*) filter (where c.sex  is null))/count(*) * 100 as sex_missing
	,(count(*) filter (where c.bmi  is null))/count(*) * 100 as bmi_missing
	,(count(*) filter (where c.race  is null)) as race_missing
	,(count(*) filter (where c.ethnic  is null)) as ethnic_missing
from (
select distinct on (a.subject)
    a.subject,
	a.age,
	a.sex,
	a.bmi,
	a.race,
	a.ethnic,
	b.flag,
	b.subject
from
	cvad.enrollment a
left join cvad.pas_id_list b
on
	a.subject = b.subject) c
where flag is not null

### DBeaver Version

23.1.1

### Operating System

windows

### Database and driver

postgresql Azure

### Steps to reproduce

_No response_

### Additional context

_No response_
author: jgrover21

comments.body:
Please try rewriting your condition this way 
`(count(*) filter (where c.age is null)) * 100 /count(*)`
or this way
`((count(*) filter (where c.age is null))::float/count(*)::float) *100`

You get 0 because when database divide integer to integer, the result is integer, but you expect to get floating point number.

title: Bind commands to multiple key combinations
body:
This is a "nice to have" feature.

I would like to be able to assign two different key sequences to a single command.

Currently, I only have one example.  I would like to bind "Find and Replace" to both the default CTRL H and CTRL F.
* CTRL H  This is "Find and Replace" in both Eclipse and Scintilla-based editors
* CTRL F  This is "Find" in Scintilla-based editors and many other software packages

This is an aid to developers with lots of experience in editors other than Eclipse.   I find myself pressing CTRL F often, with no result.  It's a little frustrating.

Jeff Bowles
author: jeff-bowles

comments.body:
I believe it's possible.
In `Window->Preferences->User Interface->Keys` you can find commands and shortcuts for them.
To assign 2 shortcuts for the same command you could select the desired command and press the "Copy Command" button. This will create a new command to which you can assign a new shortcut. Note, that if the new shortcut is already in use, you need to change the shortcut for the command use it first.

I tried to do it for your case and it works for me. If you need more details, please ask.

title: SQLite database refresh does not work.
body:
### Description

Hi. I'm having some problems with refreshing SQLite database. To reflect the recent changes (made by python script), I need to restart DBeaver. Just refreshing from context menu or by pressing F5 does not work.

### DBeaver Version

Community Edition 22.3.3

### Operating System

macOS Monterrey 12.2.1

### Database and driver

SQLite JDBC 3.40.1.0

### Steps to reproduce

- Create a database in some other application (or a python script like in my case), create a table there and insert rows with some data to this table.
- Open the database in DBeaver, invoke a SELECT query to see the data you've just added to the table.
- In other application/script delete this database, then create the same one, add the same table there and insert some rows with DIFFERENT data to the table.
- Refresh the database in DBeaver
- invoke a SELECT query again and you'll see the same data (which is actually deleted now).
- Restart DBeaver.
- invoke the same query and you'll see the new (actual) data.

### Additional context

_No response_
author: ZmicierGT

comments.body:
Hello @ZmicierGT,

This is how SQLite works. You can't access your database file from several places at the same time.

As a workaround, try reconnecting to the database instead of restarting the application.

Please let me know if it helps.

Hi @ShadelessFox Thanks for the quick reply.

If I add data to existing SQLite database from standalone script, it updates in DBeaver without problems. The problem is only when I delete the database (in the case of SQLite I mean to delete a .sqlite file) and create the same one - then refreshing does not work any more.

I'm not sure if it is a bug or a feature, but It causes problems especially when developing DB structure establishment or integrity check functions in a standalone application (then DB is deleted/created quite often during development).

I'll check if reconnecting helps and let you know then.

You can't delete the database file while there are live connections.

You can do regular migrations by deleting existing data first and then importing new data.

Please let me know if you have any questions left.

On POSIX-systems (including MacOS), it is possible to delete a file which is in use and I can delete a .sqlite file opened in DBeaver). However, the same time it fails on Windows (which is quite expected).

When such opened .sqlite file is deleted (and even if it is created anew), then DBeaver won't see any changes in the database unless it is restarted or database is reconnected. Refreshing the database won't help.

I believe in such case it is better if Refreshing would work ('see' that the file was deleted or created anew) or at least report an error (like initial database does not exist).

Currently SQLite supports concurrency. Maybe DBeaver relies on the concept that a file in use can't be deleted (which is true on Windows only) and that SQLite does not support concurrency.
Could you try using Disconnect and then Reconnect command instead of Refresh?

Sure I can. However, the purpose of this issue is to report that currently some behavior of DBeaver may seem misleading. For example, definitely it is not expected by any user that Refresh or SELECT queries work or non-existent database finely without reporting any error and providing non-relevant data. If such behavior seems ok for you, just close this issue.
This is how the driver works.

title: Cannot connect to databases
body:
### Description

Hi I appear to be having an issue connecting to postgres databases via dbeaver. I have checked and the credentials have worked on the same machine using pgadmin, so it is an issue specific to dbeaver and not an issue with the databases themselves.

Whenever I try and connect to a postgresql database I get the following error
SCRAM authentication is not supported by this driver. You need JDK >= 8 and pgjdbc >= 42.2.0 (not ".jre" versions)

Via Command Prompt my openjdk version "11.0.14.1" 2022-02-08 so that meets >= 8
Looking at driver manager my postgresql- 42.2.23.jre6 so that meets 42.2.0 criteria.

### DBeaver Version

Community Edition 22.2.0

### Operating System

Windows 10

### Database and driver

PostgreSQL 14
postgresql- 42.2.23.jre6

### Steps to reproduce

_No response_

### Additional context

_No response_
author: AS-WM

comments.body: @AS-WM  Hi, I think this happens due to the driver being compiled for `.jre6`. You should use a different driver, for example, `postgresql-42.2.25.jar`

Fixed the issue. It appears that DBeaver was holding on to an outdated library, which was being checked first, and therefore failing the test.

Steps to solve issue.
1. Download latest JDBC and move to \Program Files\DBeaver\shared_drivers
2. Open DBeaver and click Database -> Driver Manager
3. Double click on PostgreSQL
4. Under libraries click Add file and find the new JDBC
5. Delete any of the previous libraries, so it remains the only one

title: sum of selected values in 'Values' side panel
body:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**
When user selects multiple numerical, non foreign key, values in one column, 'Values' side panel displays just the first value.

Which is probably not what the user wants, since she selected multiple values.

**Describe the solution you'd like**
It would be useful to display sum of all selected values, instead of just the value of the first one, when more than one cell is selected.

author: dbojan

comments.body:
Hello @dbojan,

The value panel shows the value of the currently focused cell, not the selected one. The focused cell has a thick black border.

We don't want to change this behavior.

As a workaround, you can specify a shortcut for revealing the calculator panel in the <kbd>Preferences</kbd> ⇒ <kbd>User Interface</kbd> ⇒ <kbd>Keys</kbd>.

title: Tabbed queries do not run on seperate connections
body:
### Description

Execute a statement for a single long-running query, Now "execute a statement in a new tab" for a second query. The second query will not begin to execute until the first is completed. 

#2180 sounds similar although it was closed. I know separate SQL editors which would establish different connections which would solve this, but the current design does appear to imply that two statements running in the same editor would have a connection pool to draw the connections from, so rather than having to wait for the first statement to complete a pooled connection would allow you to dynamically scale the connections automatically. This would be only applicable to drivers that support connection pooling.

### DBeaver Version

CE 22.1.3

### Operating System

Manjaro

### Database and driver

Postgresql 14.0

### Steps to reproduce

1) Open sql editor
2) Execute a statement for a single long-running query
3) "execute a statement in a new tab" for a second query. 

The second query will not begin to execute until the first is completed. 

### Additional context

_No response_
author: notzippy

comments.body:
Hello @notzippy,

This will not work. Let me explain.

Every SQL editor is associated with its own connection. When using connection pooling, it will result in different queries executing in different connections, not sharing the common state such as transactions. Additionally, a query can depend on the result of a previously executed query. Running queries in parallel can cause any sort of weird things to happen. This can be really harmful.

title: Support configuring a JDBC driver per connection

**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**

I often have to compare the behaviour of various in-memory database products *per version*, including H2, Derby, HSQLDB, SQLite, etc.

While I think that the current global driver setting is great, I'd love to be able to "fork" the setting per connection, not affecting the global driver setting or other connections. title: Right click, lock results tab.
body:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**

More often than not, I overwrite the results of a results tab b/c I'm too focused on the current query I am trying to make.

It's usually not so bad b/c the query which made the lost result set is in the same console window.  So I can just rerun the query.  But, sometimes I don't have it, and I lose that work.  I don't often save these queries, because they are temporary, but they took me some time to iron out.  Or many times, the query that I have saved takes several minutes to reproduce.

**Describe the solution you'd like**

After a result tab appears with the results of a query.  We should be able to right click the result tab and just mark the tab as keep/locked for session.  You should be able to toggle it off in the same manner.

Then, in the sql console, if you press 'play' and that will  overwrite the current locked result set, dbeaver will warn you:

'Cannot overwrite locked result set.  Either press play in another tab or unlock the result set.'

Now have an option to 'close all unlocked result tabs'.  Or maybe modify the behavior of 'close all result tabs' so that it doesn't kill the locked results.  Finally, if you implement the 'close result tabs to the right/left', the close operation should skip the locked result tabs.




**Describe alternatives you've considered**

No alternative but to recreate/rerun the query to reproduce the lost results.


**Additional context**

None.  Keep up the good work.
author: gtdegamo

comments.body:
there should already be this feature. I can't remember if it's called lock result tab or pin result tab, but it works like you described. Running a new query will automatically open a new tab.
Also, I can add you can use the query manager (view -> windows) to see all the query you've run in the session if you need recovering one.

Hello @gtdegamo,

You can "lock" tab by using <kbd>Pin tab</kbd> action accessible via context menu.

Please let me know if this is what you want.

title: SQL Server: declaring variable before CTE
body:
#### System information: 
- Operating system (distribution) and version: Win 10 Version 1809
- DBeaver version: Version 21.1.0.202106012023
- Additional extensions: -

#### Connection specification:
- Database name and version: Microsoft SQL Server Enterprise (64-bit) 11.0.7001.0
- Driver name: Microsoft JDBC Driver for SQL Server
- Do you use tunnels or proxies (SSH, SOCKS, etc)? 

#### Describe the problem you're observing:
This query runs in SSMS but fails with error in DBeaver:
```
DECLARE @test AS INT = 42;
WITH x AS 
	(
	SELECT @test AS 'Column'
	) 
SELECT *
FROM x
```
The error message is 
```
SQL Error [137] [S0002]: Must declare the scalar variable "@test".
```

Removing the semi-colon will expectedly throw:
```
SQL Error [319] [S0001]: Incorrect syntax near the keyword 'with'. If this statement is a common table expression, an xmlnamespaces clause or a change tracking context clause, the previous statement must be terminated with a semicolon.
```
#### Steps to reproduce, if exist:
Run:
```
DECLARE @test AS INT = 42;
WITH x AS 
	(
	SELECT @test AS 'Column'
	) 
SELECT *
FROM x
```
author: serban-dobroiu

comments.body: thank you for the report

SQL Server doesn't keep session context between queries.

IF you need to execute several queries which declare/refer some variables then you need to execute them as a single query.

Just select your queries in SQL editor and run them with <kbd>ctrl+enter</kbd>.

title: Show Output as a tab (the way it was before)
body:
The output  used to show as a tab next to the results window.  Is there a way for us to move it back there. After updating to 7.3.4 it displays to the right of the SQL Query and this is rather annoying.

Was this intended or is this something that we can be given the option?
author: Moridin11

comments.body:
Hello @Moridin11,

This change was intentional and you cannot move it back like it was before.

You can disable automatic opening using <kbd>Preferences</kbd> ⇒ <kbd>Editors</kbd> ⇒ <kbd>SQL Editor</kbd> ⇒ <kbd>Open output viewer on new messages</kbd>

title: After update to 21.0: Unsupported mechanism type PLAIN
body:
```
Windows 10
dbeaver-ce-21.0.0-x86_64-setup.exe
jdbc:hive2://hiveprod.x.ch:10000/abc
<HOME>\.dbeaver-drivers\hive-jdbc-uber-2.6.5.0-292.jar
```

I just have updated Dbeaver from 7.1? to 21.0 using the installer above. My previously defined connections were preserved but the driver needed to be installed. I added manually the old file to Apache Hive Bibliothek because the download timed out.

Since I need to authenticate with Kerberos I start Dbeaver with a BAT-script using the following commands:
```
:kinit
"%kinit_path%\kinit.exe" -p -f -A %LowerUser%@%realm%

call "%dbeaver_path%\Dbeaver.exe"
```

When I want to connect to the hive/cloudera I get the following error message:
```
Could not open client transport with JDBC Uri: jdbc:hive2://hiveprod.x.ch:10000/abc: Peer indicated failure: Unsupported mechanism type PLAIN
  Peer indicated failure: Unsupported mechanism type PLAIN
  Peer indicated failure: Unsupported mechanism type PLAIN
```

With the old DBeaver version I could connect without a problem.

**Can anyone give a hint were the problem may lie? How do I change the mechanism type?**
author: kaelte

comments.body:
Now DBeaver installer goes with Java, and it can be a reason of your issue (if you have installed Java separately with custom settings). What you can try:
- delete DBeaver Java (JRE) or
- delete and install DBeaver without Java (Remove Java checkbox in the installer)

DBeaver will use your Java in this case.

there is no update on the issue for a long time.
If it is still actual for you - feel free to reopen it.

title: Lost tables after upgrade to 7.3.2
body:
#### System information: 
- Operating system (distribution) and version = Win 10 Pro x64
- DBeaver version = 7.3.2
- Additional extensions = None

#### Connection specification:
- Database name and version = postgres
- Driver name = PostresSQL
- Do you use tunnels or proxies (SSH, SOCKS, etc)? = No

#### Describe the problem you're observing:
Last time I used DBeaver I had just finished creating a new database with a significatnly large number of tables, relationships, various constraints, functions, etc, many hours of work - all in Database Navigator under
PostresSQL localhost / 
When I next started DBeaver a modal dialog opened asking me to upgrade - (I think I was currently on 6.something) I selected to upgrade and was automatically taken to the dbeaver community web page and a download began immediately.  The download was for 7.3.2 , I installed the upgrade and reopened DBeaver.

After re-opening DBeaver I was surprised to see under the (auto-reconnected) same connection I had just been using, PostresSQL localhost / 
Only the postgres (default) database, nothing else.

For a bit I thought the other databases were lost - other db management UI on re-connecting the same named connection (after upgrade), with the same properties you usually get all the same databases.

After some fiddling about, I discovered that the 'see all databases' setting on the connection must have been reset to unchecked.
Is this kind of (possibly unexpected, possibly disconcerting) behaviour following an upgrade intended? or is it a bug?

Thanks
author: hardyb

comments.body: Sorry, that you spent a time to find the reason. Some settings were changed in previous DBeaver versions and Show all databases was disabled by default. We try to avoid such changes.

title: Is it possible to keep dbeaver JRE agnostic or is there a workaround for those stuck on version 1.8?

Hello,
Unfortunately, at my company, I have to keep working with DB2 mainframe z/OS.  I have to use a specific JRE (Java 1.8) or I can't query my tables containing timestamps due to a well known legacy EDIC/CP1027 encoding issue.  Prior to recent versions of dbeaver, I could just drop my JRE folder into dbeaver's root folder and then I'm good to go.  Now however, that is not possible.  Are there some additional modifications I can do to continue using my existing JRE with recent versions of dbeaver or am I stuck with version 7.3.0?  If there is no way to get my local JRE version to work with current versions of dbeaver, that is fine, but just wanted to make sure there isn't some other workaround.  I appreciate all the work that has been put into dbeaver!

title: Filter on fully-loaded resultset issues a new query
body:
This must have been reported earlier - sorry if it was. 

In Data editor (7.3.1), when a resultset is fully-loaded in memory, any filter will run a new query on the RDBMS.
This is far from optimal since raw data is in the client's memory already, the filter could just be applied on that snapshot instead.

This is especially painful if the initial query took long to return already. Any filter would take as much time to run.

Also, once fixed, a single-key shortcut to filter by the selected cell value would be super useful !
author: yan-hic

comments.body: A little investigation was needed. FIltering executes on server side. That's why all object's data is used. This is the expected behaviour

I know it may sound silly...but I ran the following command while SSH'd into the webserver and it worked:
`mysql -u myuser -h myhost -p`

Still can't connect with DBeaver yet. :(

And it's showing 0.0.0.0 with port 3306.

I don't know why exactly, but this worked for me. :D Lots of manuals and trouble shooting guides later this fixed it for me:
`GRANT ALL PRIVILEGES ON DBNAME.* TO 'DBUSER'@'%' WITH GRANT OPTION;`

then I reapplied with:
`FLUSH PRIVILEGES;`

And for whatever reason it's working again! :dancers: 

_Edit: Some of the server updates I did were mariadb files so I'm guessing something got updated or overwritten...not sure though._
Thanks for anyone reading this, but I closed and re-opened DBeaver to confirm all's well and it reconnected again. _faints_ :P

title: Is it possible to export/import virtual foreign keys?
body: The virtual foreign keys feature is super helpful since we decided against keeping foreign keys in the actual schema. We have multiple versions of each database, so it'd be helpful to copy over virtual key definitions instead of redefining them each time. Same goes for sharing the config with teammates
author: mwalkerr

comments.body:
Virtual foreign key are saved in .dbeaver/data-sources.json in project folder. Default project folder is workspace\workspace6\General.
Also you could use Git extension to share it.

@mwalkerr @uslss 
Hi guys. Did you success to share virtual foreign key? I found the "virtual-models" key in data-sources.json file and I try to use it for sharing the virtual key but I can't. Could you tell me the way to export/import it? Thanks

@tuananh281098
Sorry, I can't offer much help here since I haven't used DBeaver in a while. I think you can make this work but there's no convenient UI in the application to do it. Re-using virtual keys in a different installation would require copying over that data-sources.json file (or at least inserting the relevant bits). I believe I ended up deciding that it was more work than it was worth and ultimately gave up on trying to export them

@mwalkerr 
Thanks for your response

title: Implementing Code Completion for a database - how should the code behave?
body:
I had filed a few issues around code completion for the Hana database and debugged the code. I can see how it works but at a few places I don't know how DBeaver is supposed to work. Also looked at the Oracle implementation for reference but some questions are open still. If you can help me to understand what DBeaver should do for all databases, I can bring SAP Hana up to the standard. And if something is not implemented in DBeaver yet, I must no longer search for the non-existing code.

* Caching of the suggestion list: In my point of view the cache should be updated at certain cases but is not
  * Application restart: It seems the list is cached across application restarts. Is that a good idea? How to change the default? Where is it cached?
  * A drop/create table/view/synonym should modify the cache. Does it for other databases?
  * How can a user force the suggestion list to be invalidated and reloaded? Found no traces of that.
  * When the user does refresh the database navigator, shouldn't that update the impacted parts of the suggestion list?
* Object types: The suggestion list is called with an object type but what should it return?
  * Per my finding the suggestion list for TABLE should return all objects a user can use in select-from clauses. So tables, views, synonyms. Correct?
  * That raises the question on when the type VIEW is provided. The only use case I can see is when a user types "drop view ...". Then only views make sense. Is that the desired logic? In Oracle I have not seen that.

Thanks in advance!
author: wernerdaehn

comments.body: I also really miss an easy way of refreshing the suggestion list. The only way I know is to refresh the connection and then reattach it to the script, but it is really anoying.

I am still trying to find my way around that. When I pulled the most recent version yesterday, I believe the code works differently now. The HANAStructureAssistant is no longer called at all but instead the entire schema from the database navigator is used.
Actually, I believe that is the better approach anyhow. It means a refresh of the schema does refresh code completion, once a drop table SQL changes the database navigator it changes the autocomplete list as well.
Frankly it solves the entire problem space in fact. 
I will play around with that some more, check if all Hana objects suited for auto completion are present and maybe make code changes.

@serge-rider Can you please confirm that my findings are correct and I am heading into the proper direction? Still trying to find my way...

Thanks,
Brent

there aren't any updates for a long time.
Issue closed. If it is still actual for you - feel free to reopen it

title: SQL Group By and Calculation question
body:
Hi Guys,

I am new to SQL and I am trying to create some queries in DBeaver.  I have some questions regarding aggregation by using group by. I will use an example output table to explain (THIS IS THE OUTPUT by running my query):

ID                SubType     Data 1     Data 2   Data 3   Data 4
Sample 1       A               Null         Null       21          22
Sample 1       B               20            15         Null        Null

So in here, I have used where statement to select sample 1, then based on group by subtype, I can retrieve different information from Sample 1 (based on subtype, some data will be Null as shown from the table due to the reason that some data is only available for either A or B).  

Now the first difficulty for me: I want to create a new column "Data 5" for part B and the formula will be using 20 from Data 1 column, 15 Data 2 column and 21 from Data 3 column - i.e. 20/(21-15).  Is this possible to make new output based on output results? Hope I don't confuse you here.

title: How to completely uninstall DBeaver on Mac
body:
#### System information: 
- macOS Catalina 10.15.6 (19G73)
- DBeaver version: 7.1.5

#### Describe your question:

I want to completely remove everything DBeaver related and start over fresh with a brand new install that will not remember any of my preferences, cache, history, settings, connections, drivers, etc.

How can I do this on Mac? I've tried a few routes and after I reinstall, I can tell on opening it again that not everything got removed (it'll remember connection info, theme, etc.).
author: jim256

comments.body:
If you need to cleanup all your local files/settings then you can simple delete directory `~/Library/DBeaverData`.
Don't forget to close DBeaver before that.
@serge-rider , thank you. I think this worked. After I did that, rebooted, and re-installed, the only thing that was still the same was that it was using the dark theme. Is that now the default?

On MacOS dark theme is default if you use dark theme in MacOS itself.
In any case you can change it in the Preferences->Appearance.
Thanks. Closing.

title: SSH certificate support in SSH tunnel
body:
Hi Team, 

I am using an SSH certificate to access my servers. But there is no option to add SSH certificate, in SSH tunnel tab there is an option to add public key but it only accepts private key file to authenticate. On selecting the certificate file, I am getting an error: 

 _Can't initialize tunnel
  Cannot establish tunnel
  Cannot establish tunnel
    invalid privatekey: [B@5ecde315_

On terminal I am able to ssh using:  **ssh -i id-cert.pub username@servername**

It would be really nice to have the feature embedded out-of-the-box.

Is there any workaround for this, as I am stuck.

Thanks in advance.
author: arghaya

comments.body: thanks for suggestion

Really a great feature to have. This will provide much more security to the SSH tunnelling.

@arghaya, thanks for sharing!!

I also could not find accurate solution from dbeaver, but following hack should help you solve the issue

execute the command from terminal

**ssh -i id-cert.pub -fNL 3308:localhost:3307  username@server.com**

In the above command 
1. replace 3308 for local port through which all requests should be served
2. 3307 is the port where service on remote server is listening

So after that in Dbeaver you can configure using localhost and port used for tunnelling.
Thanks @RajeshJangid  works like a charm.
@RajeshJangid, you ROCK!!

title: Access: allow AccessSQL only
body:
Currently I am trying to develop queries for an Access 2013 DB.
While those queries work well in DBeaver, they often do not when pasted in Acess.

After some research I learned that Access on top of all its other shortcomings does not support all SQL features DBeaver (or rather UCanaccess) allows.
Additionally, it requires an inordinate and rarely intuitive amount of braces to be put elsewhere.

So, if possible, it would be of great help to let DBeaver's SQL editor accept only that subset of SQL Access natively accepts (and maybe even propose the braces - there seem in fact to be rules for those, though I fail to grasp them).
That way I could extensively check queries and simply copy them over to Access once finished.

comments.body: thanks for suggestion

Unfortunately we can't control this as Access SQL dialect is provided by UCanAccess driver. It is based on hsqldb engine as far as I know.

Alternatively you could use Access ODBC driver.

Also there are several other commercial Access drivers which use Access engine directly so there shouldn't be any problems with SQL dialect compatibility.

title: "Read data in SQL console" should not create dirty editor
body:
On a table rmc -> "Read data in SQL console" opens an editor with the SQL query executed.
Closing the editor w/o any change nevertheless prompts "Save changes in Script-XXX.sql?"

Since the editor's contents
a) are automatically generated and thus always the same
b) have not manually changed
the prompt is unnecessary, and in respect to b) unjustified, and should not appear at all.

comments.body:
Hint: don't use "Read data in SQL console" if you need to read table data only. Use "View data" action or just double-click on a table and switch to "Data" tab.

"Read data in SQL console" is supposed to be used when you are planning to change the query manually.

As it is today it's just confusing "why does it say fetching table data *forever* when I run this SQL query..." so it would be nice to either make it the default or have some other status shown ("waiting for connection that's being used in other tab...") to reduce the confusion...

title: Support PKCS11 SSH authentication method
body:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**
At my company we use yubikeys in combination with the OpenSC PKCS11 module for authentication. Currently I can't find a way to use this in dbeaver, and I currently manually create a SSH tunnel before opening the connection on dbeaver.

**Describe the solution you'd like**
Built-in support for PKCS11 so that any authentication module may be used for creating a SSH tunnel.

**Describe alternatives you've considered**
Manually creating a SSH tunnel on the command line works, but requires additional steps and I can't reasonably expect everyone else on my team to be doing the same. I tried using the "before connect" shell commands that dbeaver offers, but I couldn't get it to work when the PKCS11 module asks for user input (i.e. a pin number for the smart card or yubikey).
author: rnijveld

comments.body:
Perhaps BouncyCastle security provider will fix this.
For that you could try to install SSHJ optional package (Help->Install New Software, then choose it from drop-down menu). 
And then switch your connection's SSH config from JSch to SSHJ.

IF this won't help please provide more details (error messages/log files would be very helpful)

title: Table name containing character : (colon) causes Code completion not working
body:
Dbeaver 5.2.2 with HANA.
Please include character :  (colon) in valid characters for table name. In our HANA project, lots of tables contains this character, and so code completion for columns is currently not working on those tables.
author: olivier-75

comments.body:
Same applies for spaces and $. 
Bothe code completion for columns and table names breaks.

: and other special characters are not part of standard identifiers, such identifiers have to be quoted.

Workaround: if you start the identifier with a quote (like `SELECT * FROM "T`) then autocompletion also support these special characters

title: Suggestion: use new version number when releasing hotfixes
body:
When you release hotfixes, like you did with 5.2.3, you continue to receive duplicate bug reports until the next version. I think it would help you to release hotfixes not as 5.2.3 but as 5.2.3.1, 5.2.3.2, ...

Doing it this way, the new version check would tell users a new version is available and the number of duplicate bug reports should lower.
author: p91paul

comments.body:
Agreed. 
We already use build numbers (like `5.2.3.201810182116`) but build number is not used in GitHub tags / release announcements.
Not sure how to handle this better..
Aren't tags something **you** choose? I don't believe Github forces you to max 3 version components when creating a release, does it?

GitHub doesn't force us in any fashion. But we have: Maven artifact versions, Eclipse OSGI bundles versions, Windows binaries versions, Apple bundles versions, Debian packages versions, RPM versions and probably some other versioning systems which we must conform.

Sooo, that's a bit tricky. 3 version components (numeric) are supported by all mentioned systems.

Ok, what about you increase the second number every 2 weeks instead of the third, which would be left for hotfixes? Sure the second number would go up quite fast, but I think it would get to something like 5.20-5.30, not 5.100 before 6.0 is out.

My personal opinion is that you should release less often, or alternate a feature release with one or more bugfix-only while you work on new features on a different branch, but that's quite offtopic here.

Another alternative is using 5.2.4 for 5.2.3 hotfixes, but that would be a PITA because you would need to move all your planned issue to the next milestone.

Changing the update checker to include the build number in the check might not be feasible and would not solve the issue for those updating through debian or rpm repositories....this is a difficult issue indeed!
Yep. We are thinking about some changes here. As you may see we have a lot of tickets. Two-weeks sprints may be too short to handle them properly..
I believe this issue can be safely closed, it's your internal policy anyway. :smile:
